page.title: 06A HISTORY OF HALTON
page.content: In{1133}Widnesians had to pay their taxes at Halton Castle. In{1178}John FitzRichard,the sixth Earl of Halton,instituted the{Widnes {Runcorn ferry}made famous by Stanley Holloway in his 'Twopence per person per trip'This was the only way across the Mersey at Runcorn Gap for nearly 700 years. In{1868}the{railway bridge}was completed and named{Ethelfreda}after the daughter of Alfred the Great. In{1905}Sir John Brunner opened the {Transporter Bridge}which continued running until 22 July 1961. In{1961}Princess Alexandra opened the {New Road Bridge.} In{1974}Widnes,which had always been} located in the County of{Lancashire was declared to be in{Cheshire}under the new boundary changes.Once again Widnes became part of{Halton.
